ICSAtlanta is 1 out of only 6 schools in Georgia to receive a RAMP designation this year from the American School Counselor Association!

Congratulations to Ms. Appleby-Johnson for her hard work and dedication in the creation of our ASCA Model Program!

This year's Georgia recipients:
International Charter School of Atlanta
Norcross Elementary School
Puckett’s Mill Elementary School (Re-RAMP)
Sprayberry High School
Varner Elementary School
White Oak Elementary School
The Recognized ASCA Model Program (RAMP) designation, awarded for aligning with the criteria in the ASCA National Model, recognizes schools committed to delivering a data-informed school counseling program and an exemplary educational environment. Since the program’s inception, nearly 1,000 schools have been designated as RAMP recipients.

MYTH: Charter schools are private schools.
TRUTH: Every single charter school in America, without exception, is a tuition-free public school. Charter schools are publicly funded by local, state, and federal tax dollars based on student enrollment, just like all other public schools. Charter schools expand public school options for families that may be dissatisfied with their local schools, but cannot afford private school. Charter schools must meet the same academic standards that all public schools are required to meet.
